modules.description: This module handles IPv6 packet input, output, and address management with operations for sending and receiving IP frames, demultiplexing protocols, and computing checksums. It works with IPv6 addresses (`Ipaddr.V6.t`), network buffers (`Cstruct.t`), and result types for error handling. Concrete use cases include processing incoming IPv6 packets, transmitting fragmented or unfragmented IPv6 datagrams, and determining source addresses and MTU for IPv6 destinations.

This module implements TCP/IP networking over IPv4, handling connection setup, data transmission, and flow control. It provides functions to create client connections, listen on ports, send and receive data with optional buffering controls, and manage connection lifecycle events. Concrete use cases include implementing network servers and clients that require reliable, stream-oriented communication over IPv4.

This module implements UDP communication over IPv6, providing functions to send and receive datagrams with explicit source and destination addresses and ports. It supports listening on specific ports to handle incoming packets, writing outgoing packets with configurable TTL, and disconnecting from the UDP layer. Use cases include implementing IPv6-based network services, handling multicast or unicast UDP traffic, and integrating with low-level networking stacks.

This module implements IPv6 TCP communication with functions to establish connections, send and receive data, and manage flow endpoints. It operates on IPv6 addresses and TCP flows, supporting operations like `read`, `write`, `writev`, and their `nodelay` variants, along with connection management via `create_connection`, `listen`, and `close`. Concrete use cases include building IPv6 network servers and clients that require reliable stream-based communication with control over buffering and connection lifecycle.

This module handles UDP communication over IPv4, providing functions to send and receive datagrams with explicit source and destination addresses and ports. It supports listening on specific ports for incoming packets, writing packets with configurable TTL, and managing connection state with asynchronous disconnect. Concrete use cases include implementing DNS clients, SNMP agents, or time synchronization protocols where lightweight, connectionless transport is required.

This module handles IPv4 packet input, output, and address management. It provides functions to send and receive IP packets, manage fragmentation, and compute checksum pseudoheaders. Concrete use cases include implementing network protocols that require direct IPv4 handling, such as custom routing or low-level network diagnostics.

This module provides a comprehensive interface for handling IPv4 and IPv6 networking across TCP and UDP transport layers. It supports low-level packet management, including sending and receiving IP frames, handling fragmentation, and computing checksums, while also offering high-level connection-oriented and connectionless communication through TCP and UDP. Key data types include IPv4 and IPv6 addresses (`Ipaddr.V4.t`, `Ipaddr.V6.t`), network buffers (`Cstruct.t`), and result types for error handling. Specific capabilities include implementing network servers and clients for reliable TCP communication, handling UDP datagrams with explicit addressing, and performing low-level operations like custom routing or network diagnostics.
